definition: to compromise/to take the middle road/a trade-off/eclectic
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
variant of 折[zhe2]/to fold
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
China/Chinese/surname Zhong

sentences.english: OK, a compromise would be to change the wording.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，一个折中的方案就是修改文字措辞。

sentences.english: That's the best trade-off I can think of, given an unexpected problem occurred.
sentences.chinese: 假如发生意外问题，这是我所能想到的最佳折中方式。

sentences.english: That's what the moderates would say.
sentences.chinese: 那是折中主义者的说法。

sentences.english: But we have a political system that has become allergic to compromise and practical solutions.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们拥有一个对折中和现实解决过敏的政治系统。

sentences.english: There must be an inbetween here for a business sense of being.
sentences.chinese: 在商业意识中肯定会有一个“折中选择”。

sentences.english: The said sound-controlled keyboard is a compromise design of sound-control computer and common keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 声控键盘是声控电脑与普通键盘的折中设计。

sentences.english: That seems an eminently reasonable middle course to me.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说那似乎是非常合理的折中办法。

sentences.english: That's how the neutralists put it.
sentences.chinese: 这是折中主义者的观点。

sentences.english: However, given the preparation time is too short, everyone still take compromise.
sentences.chinese: 不过，鉴于备战时间过短，大家还是采取折中的方法。

sentences.english: Let's compromise and each pay half the damages.
sentences.chinese: 我们采取折中办法吧，每人付一半的赔偿费。

sentences.english: Mixed gold tail eclectic parrot 4 months not weaned.
sentences.chinese: 混金尾折中鹦鹉4个月大还没断奶。

sentences.english: The discussion eventuated in a compromise.
It's eclectic and versatile and has some cool vocals.
sentences.chinese: 它是折中的也是多方面的而且有一些很酷的演奏乐器。

sentences.english: Let’s compromise and each pay half the damages.
sentences.chinese: 让我们采取折中的办法，每人各赔一半的损伤费用。

sentences.english: I think I have a really eclectic style.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我是个折中主义者。

sentences.english: The essence of Liang Shuming's opinion of culture in his early period is eclecticism.
sentences.chinese: 梁漱溟这一早期文化观的实质就是折中主义。

definition: variant of 折中[zhe2 zhong1]
to settle for second best/the next best thing
dependable
(of sb who ostensibly collaborated with the Japanese during the Sino-Japanese war of 1937-1945) to secretly work for the Nationalists or against the Communists
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
expedient
to compromise/to reach terms/a compromise
to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
feasible
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
middle road (in politics)
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
